Author: Somerset Maugham, W.
Title: Louise
Notes: Short story in collection: Cosmopolitans, 1936; B: Stimmen der Völker, Meisternovellen der Weltliteratur: England, tr. Wagenseil (Bavaria-Verlag: Gauting, 1947), here story illustrated by Claus Hansmann; Slight difference between tr. in KA und in short story collection; Slightly later competing translation by Mimi Zoff, Weltbürger (Zürich: Rascher, 1948)

Author: Thurber, James
Title: Das Rätselspiel
Notes: B: Der Mann in mittleren Jahren am fliegenden Trapez

Author: Somerset Maugham, W.
Title: Der Landstreicher
Notes: Short story in collection: Cosmopolitans, 1936, original title “The Bum”; Illustrator in KA Steffi Kohl

Author: Isjagin, Fedor B.
Title: Der Mann, der aus Liebe tötete
Notes: Illustrator in KA Hanna Nagel

Author: Thurber, James
Title: Die Kaninchen, die an allem schuld waren
Notes: Short story: “The Rabbits Who Caused All the Trouble”, New Yorker, 26th August 1939, then in collection Fables for Our Time and Famous Poems Illustrated (Harper and Brothers 1940), and The Thurber Carnival (Harper and Brothers 1945); originally with image by Thurber that reproduced in KA. Fable with animal protagonists (persecuted minorities), main message: There is no world for escapists/cowards. Translation v different from 1950 Rowohlt publication

Author: Louÿs, Pierre
Title: Das Schicksal der Esther van Gobseck
Notes: Illustrator in KA Bele Bachem

Author: Saroyan, William
Title: Die Liebe gehört den Liebenden
Notes: B: Erzähler von drüben (Wiesbaden: Limes, 1947), short story collection, tr. Wagenseil; Slight differences between tr. in KA und in short story collection; Illustrator in KA Hans Fischer

Author: Faulkner, William
Title: Eine Rose für Miß Emily
Notes: Short Story: A Rose for Emily, published Saturday Evening Post 1930, also in Forum 30th April 1930; 1931 in collection These 13; No interwar German translation: next published translation, Elisabeth Schnack for Diogenes 1965; Illustrator in KA Henri Meyer-Brockmann

Author: Woolf, Virginia
Title: Der Beau
Notes: Illustrator in KA Walter Nikusch

Author: Gorny, Sergej
Title: Nach Maupassant
Notes: Prose story – NB Harriet Schleber’s publishing house in KS produces a short story collection Mit leisen Schritten – Slight differences of tense between Schleber book and KA translation; Illustrator in KA Marianne Kuntze-Just

Author: Nicolson, Harold
Title: Hauptmann Dreyfus auf dem Weihnachtsbaum
Notes: Illustrator in KA Albert Schäfer-Ast

Author: Sackville-West, Vita
Title: Gespräch auf dem Dach
Notes: B: The Edwardians (1930): Schloß Chevron (1931, tr. Hans Wagenseil); Republished in Erzähler von drüben (Wiesbaden: Limes, 1947); Illustrator in KA Albert Schäfer-Ast

Author: Cocteau, Jean
Title: Einseitiges Zwiegespräch
Notes: One-act piece /short story: La Voix humaine (1930); Interwar German translations do exist, but not by Wagenseil

Author: Parker, Dorothy
Title: Eine üppige Blondine
Notes: Short Story: Big Blonde (1929); German edition Kurzgeschichten (Zürich: Humanitas, 1947), tr. Eva Roeder; rather different translation from in KA; Illustrator in KA Karl Staudinger

Author: Nicolson, Harold
Title: William Fletcher
Notes: Short story in Small Talk (Tauchnitz, 1938); Read on the BBC Third Programme on 28th May 1947; also Miniature Biographies No. i, broadcast BBC National Service, 23rd Oct 1929 and printed in Listener, 30th Oct 1929; B: Begegnungen und Betrachtungen, tr. Wagenseil (München: Desch, 1947); minimal differences KA and book

Author: Gorny, Sergej
Title: Kuka
Notes: Illustrator in KA Eva Schwimmer

Author: Thurber, James
Title: Wie Mr. Preble seine Frau los wurde
Notes: Darkly humorous story "Mr Preble gets rid of his wife", originally published New Yorkr, 4th March 1933, KA: "Aus dem Amerikanischen"

Author: Millay, Edna St. Vincent
Title: Unfruchtbare Zeit
Notes: KA: "Aus dem Amerikanischen"

Author: Nicolson, Harold
Title: Fluch der deutschen Gründlichkeit
Notes: Illustrator in KA Hans Fischer

Author: Sackville-West, Vita
Title: Dreißig Uhren schlagen die Stunde
Notes: Short Story: Thirty Clocks Strike the Hour; The Yale Review, Autumn 1929, issue 19.1.; Short Stories (Doubleday Doran, 1932); B: Erzähler von drüben (Wiesbaden: Limes, 1947), short story collection, tr. Wagenseil; Translation in KA identical with that in collection; Illustrator in KA Bele Bachem

Author: Camus, Albert
Title: Caligula
Notes: B: Munich: Desch, 1946. This translation to be used for first German performance of the play, Stuttgart, Württembergisches Landestheater, autumn 1947.

Author: Parker Butler, Ellis
Title: Schwein ist Schwein
Notes: Short story Pigs is Pigs (1905), no German translation prior to publication in KA; B: Erzähler von drüben (Wiesbaden: Limes, 1947), short story collection, tr. Wagenseil; Slight differences between tr. in KA und in short story collection; Illustrator in KA Albert Schäfer-Ast;

Author: Anderson, Sherwood
Title: Landstreicher-Melodie
Notes: B: Dark Laughter, 1926, no interwar German translation, hence presumably first here; Dunkles Lachen; Illustrator in KA Jo Kalckreuth

Author: Dickinson, Emily
Title: Spätsommer
Notes: KA: “Aus dem Amerikanischen”

Author: Gorny, Sergej
Title: Die Lilie
Notes: B: Mit leisen Schritten, Schleber Verlag

Author: Hemingway, Ernest
Title: Der Kämpfer
Notes: B: „The Battler“ Chapter V of Hemingway's short story collection, In Our Time (1925). Appeared as In unserer Zeit (1932), tr. Horschitz, republished with Rowohlt, 49 Stories (Hamburg 1950); KA: “Aus dem amerikanischen“; Illustrator Walter Meng; NB slight differences 1950 Rowohlt translation and translation in KA; have 1932 and 1950 translation

Author: Millay, Edna St. Vincent
Title: Apostrophe an den Menschen
Notes: “Apostrophe to Man (On reflecting that the world is ready to go to war again)”; KA: “Aus dem Amerikanischen”

Author: Sostschenko, Michail
Title: Schuld und Sühne
Notes: Possibly from short story collection published with Harriet Schleber, Kassel, 1947; Minimal differences between book and KA translation

Author: Saki
Title: Laura
Notes: Original title „Laura“; Illustrator in KA Albert Schäfer-Ast. Saki is Hector Hugh Munro's pseudonym.

Author: Kossacz, Georgij
Title: Nocturne B-Moll
Notes: Illustrator in KA Karl Staudinger

Author: Cheever, John
Title: Wonne der Einsamkeit
Notes: Appeared in The New Yorker
